title: Improper Password Reset Policy on https://hosted.weblate.org/

profile.name: Weblate
profile.about: Weblate is a libre software web-based continuous localization system

vulnerability_information:
Application should not allow the user to set the last 3-5 password in terms of secure design principles. It should give a warning or provide such avoidance while user is using repetitive usage of passwords.

Repro:
1. Try to set same old password via Password Reset link.

Fix: Application should avoid user to set last history of passwords to enforce the security.

Let me know if any further info is required.

Regards,
Mr_R3boot.

activities.message:
Just checked application not even asking to include Numbers and Special Characters. 
Eg: I am able to set abcdefg as my password.

activities.message:
The latter issue has been just fixed - https://github.com/WeblateOrg/weblate/commit/f743441990515d7492aff1bbbec373045f54506a

As for past passwords, I'm not really convinced this is good idea to enforce this. First of all it's the user who decides to change password (having policy to enforce password changes seems to be bad idea, see for example https://www.schneier.com/blog/archives/2016/08/frequent_passwo.html) and I don't see problem with user setting again password he had used before. Enforcing different password will lead exactly to same changes as with enforced password change and this really doesn't bring any additional security.

activities.message:
As per security concern i'll suggest best thing here while enforcing the new password following checks should be performed.

1. Last 3-5 used passwords shouldn't be allowed ( Which will save user privacy in case if site has been compromised and credentials are sold somewhere. If still user setting same passwords will leads to full account takeover).
2. Application should have the strong password enforcing policy (An adult should get belief that the application having good security measures).

activities.message:
The password policy is there as of https://github.com/WeblateOrg/weblate/commit/f743441990515d7492aff1bbbec373045f54506a and I thing it's good enough for first iteration. We might add more checks later.

I'm not interested in storing past passwords for users, it really sounds like storing more information than is necessary and it brings no real value (people will end up adding digits to the password). Being able to find similarity with past passwords would require storing them in plain text, what is even worse idea.
